rights.description: Written requests must receive response within 10 business days; records should be made available 'as soon as practicable'
rights.implementation_notes: Records should be made available as quickly as possible
rights.request_tips: Agency must respond to written request within 10 business days

rights.description: May charge for staff time only in excess of one hour
rights.conditions: First hour of work is free
rights.implementation_notes: Protects against fees for routine requests
rights.request_tips: First hour of agency work is always free - only charged if exceeds 60 minutes

rights.description: Fees may be waived or reduced if disclosure would be in the public interest
rights.implementation_notes: Journalists and civic requesters often qualify
rights.request_tips: Request fee waiver if information serves public interest

rights.description: Administrative review via Office of Hearing Examiners, then circuit court action within 90 days
rights.conditions: Office of Hearing Examiners for administrative review; circuit court for judicial review
rights.applies_to: All requesters challenging denials or fees
rights.implementation_notes: Administrative remedy available before court action
rights.request_tips: File notice of review with Office of Hearing Examiners for administrative resolution

rights.description: Court may award costs if agency acted unreasonably
rights.request_tips: If agency acts unreasonably, costs recoverable in court action

rights.description: No statement of purpose required; no identification required; no restrictions on use of records
rights.conditions: Both citizens and non-citizens may request
rights.implementation_notes: Open to all persons regardless of residency
rights.request_tips: You do not need to identify yourself, state purpose, or be a resident

rights.description: Presumption that all public records are accessible (reversed from pre-2009 confidentiality presumption)
rights.implementation_notes: SIGNIFICANT REFORM: 2009 law reversed prior confidentiality presumption
rights.request_tips: Cite presumption of public access - major 2009 reform establishing openness as default
Submit electronically for documentation and faster delivery

rights.description: Records available for inspection as soon as practicable during business hours
rights.request_tips: Request in-person inspection during business hours

rights.description: Each governmental body must have designated custodian for records
rights.request_tips: Direct requests to designated custodian of records

validation_metadata.notes: All rights extracted from verified jurisdiction-data.json file. South Dakota has strong requester protections including: 10 business day response requirement, first hour free, fee waiver for public interest, two-tier appeal process, costs for unreasonable agency action, and presumption of public access (2009 reform reversed prior confidentiality presumption).
